title: Marker Maker
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

The Marker Maker is responsible for the creation and distribution of markers for Canada Goose and all its vendors.  This position is accountable for creating markers with the Gerber Accumark System to achieve the best material utilization possible.   Markers are tailored to specific Purchase Orders and to the cutting room standards of individual vendors.

Qualifications

Key Responsibilities:

  • Creating and updating sample and production markers in the Gerber Accumark system
  • Creating markers for best material utilization while respecting pattern and fabric quality boundaries
  • Plotting and/or preparing electronic files for individual vendors/production orders (POs) according to the timelines on Production Schedule
  • Calculating yields for costing and material ordering purposes
  • Maintenance of plotters and tracking of plotters’ utilization
  • Responsible for the maintenance of plotters
  • All other duties as assigned

Experience, Education and Designations:

  • College Degree or Diploma in apparel design and manufacturing
  • 2-3 years’ experience in marker making
  • 2-3 years’ experience using Gerber Accumark, experience with other CAD systems an asset
  • 2-3 years’ experience working with cutting rooms, familiarity with both auto and manual cutting

 

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:

  • Knowledge of pattern making & sewing is an asset
  • Experience with outerwear garments is an asset
  • Ability work independently, with little supervision
  • Strong computer skills - Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Should be organized, detail oriented, team player, multi-task oriented
  • Effective communication & interpersonal skills required to build relationships across the business
  • Consistently exhibits Canada Goose’s Values, taking pride in being innovative, respectful, passionate, accountable, and entrepreneurial while exhibiting personal commitment

 

Working Conditions:

  • Manufacturing/Office Environment

The Leather product die cutting operator is responsible to check leather and their materials and cutting dies, select areas to be cut, position pieces on the leather and other materials, match the leather goods components (pieces) and check cut pieces against specifications and quality requirements. All the activities and tasks are performed manually.

Grow with us as a Glass Cutter at Stage Windows & Doors!

Company Overview:

Stage Windows & Doors is a manufacturer of custom products tailored to meet client needs. With a facility located in Vaughan, we offer a variety of options and features that are designed to make our windows and doors ideal for residential replacement and custom home markets. Our focus is on providing our customer's value through on-time delivery, quality, and superior service. We strive to build a work environment where safety, respect, commitment, success, and fun are driving principles.

Position Summary:

The Glass Cutter will play a vital role by contributing to the workflow of the Glass department ensuring safe, accurate, and timely processing of client orders. Working within a small team, the right candidate will be passionate about delivering high-quality work, with a “roll up your sleeves” kind of attitude.

This is a full-time position that requires strong detail-oriented, organization, and teamwork skills and someone who is well versed in glass line and production environments. The successful candidate will be disciplined, punctual, and a strong team player dedicated to generating an engaged and safe work environment.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Review customer orders and pick glass accordingly
  • Load glass onto cutting tables and/or machines
  • Interpret drawings and cut patterns from blueprints and templates
  • Cut glass to a particular size and shape using hand tools and machines according to operational specifications and health and safety standards
  • Assist colleagues with loading and unloading glass
  • Dispose of scrap pieces according to company protocols and health and safety standards
  • Actively contribute to meeting production goals
  • Assist other departments as necessary
  • Other tasks as assigned

Skills:
  • Machine operating experience
  • Ability to manually cut glass is considered an asset
  • Concisely read, understand, and interpret metric and imperial systems, drawings, and blueprints
  • Time management and project prioritization skills
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs

Education & Experience:
  • Relevant Trades certification
  • 5+ years of machine operating experience within the windows manufacturing industry, preferably glass lines

title: Supply Chain Intern
description:
Company Description


At Freud Canada a division of Robert Bosch GMBH, we know that every career matters. Which is why you should conduct yours on a grand scale. Located in Mississauga Ontario we are an integral part of a multinational engineering and electronics organization and the largest privately held employer in the world.

Freud is the industry-leading manufacturer of premium cutting tools and abrasives. Freud manufactures two brands of cutting tools: Freud Tools for the woodworker (www.freudtools.com) and Diablo Tools for the professional construction and remodeler market (www.diablotools.com).

Freud Canada, Inc. is headquartered in Mississauga, ON and is the home of our Canadian Distribution Center as well as most corporate functions.

Freud is the only manufacturer of woodworking tools in the world that produces its own MicroGrain Carbide with titanium, called TiCo™, a high-density combination of titanium and cobalt. By producing their own carbide, Freud has the unique ability to formulate each tool for each specific application, thereby maximizing the cutting life and performance of the tool. Freud’s full line of high-quality woodworking tools includes saw blades, router bits, shaper cutters, and more.

Guided by the principles of founder Robert Bosch, we offer a setting where social and environmental responsibility are part of our corporate DNA. Always mindful of our impact on the future, we are committed to sustainability, paying it forward, giving back, and lifelong learning. These are but a few of the reasons why our parent company has more than 390,000 associates and a legacy of success spanning 135+ years.

This is your chance to Go big. Go bold. And use your skills to drive success on a massive scale, with Freud Canada.


Job Description


Diablo/Freud is looking for an organized, highly motivated, and driven supply chain/logistics recent graduate with a competitive fire to fill our Supply Chain Intern role.

The role is for a one year contract term.

Organize supply and demand across the extended supply chain in order to achieve service level target in the most efficient manner.

  • Demand Planning: Manage sales forecasts, promotional planning, new product launches in order to constantly update demand patterns in the system and for the suppliers.

Collaborate with Sales and Controlling to manage phase out and sell off of excess and obsolete product.

  • Must be a 2022 (or within the last 6 months) recent graduate of a supply chain or logistics program.

  • Assignments are broad in nature requiring originality and ingenuity. May occasionally lead or direct the work of others.
  • Demonstrates in-depth knowledge and the ability to resolve complex issues. Proven experience in planning and accomplishing goals. Operates with substantial latitude for reviewed action or decision. Provides guidance to others.
  • Demonstrates knowledge and experience with SAP.
  • Intermediate computer program proficiency in MS Office, particularly MS Excel.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Able to lift up to 60lbs.

Additional Information


By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce and are an equal opportunity employer. Robert Bosch welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

title: Welder/Fitter/Fabricator
description:
Are you looking to apply your skills with a company that has a long track record of growth and success? Are you available to work afternoons? The AVL Manufacturing, Inc. Fabricating team is looking for a Welder/Fitter with notable experience working in a fast-paced, manufacturing environment.

About us:

The AVL Group of Companies was founded in 1998. Hamilton Metal Works® (H.M.W), the founding company of the group, focused primarily on large custom fabrications and machining. In 2006, H.M.W. changed its name to AVL Manufacturing™, adding full assembly, project management, and single-source supply chain services to its portfolio. AVL Manufacturing has now transformed into one of Canada’s largest privately-owned engineering, manufacturing, and assembly facilities.

Job Summary:

The Welder/Fitter’s primary function is to layout, position, align, fit and secure large and complex structural components and framing based on technical drawings, schematics, welding process specifications, and other documentation in a manufacturing environment.

Job Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:

  • Read and interpret drawings, blueprints, sketches, diagrams, and welding process specifications, including the interpretation of welding symbols and tolerances in fractions, decimals, and metric dimensions.
  • Rig, hoist, and move materials to storage areas or within worksite using overhead cranes and tow motors using established safety precautions.
  • Prepare work staging area and construct patterns or jigs/templates as guides for layouts.
  • Determine the materials required, and plan the sequence of tasks to cut metal most efficiently. Layout reference points and patterns on heavy metal according to specifications.
  • Assemble and fit metal sections and plates to form complete units or subunits using tack welding, bolting, riveting or other methods.
  • Set up and operate various heavy-duty metal-working machines cutting using saws, ironworkers, torches, plasma and gouging, manual or semi-automatic welding machines, grinders.
  • Brace weldments to minimize distortion from welding and perform heat straightening of weldments. Perform dimensional inspections
  • Provide feedback on design improvements through communication with the supervisor and assist in the preparation of the Engineering Change Request form.
  • Ensure standards for safe working conditions are observed in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and participate in regular safety talks. Perform a visual inspection of equipment including cranes, welding machines, cutters, and other tools to ensure they are in safe working condition.
  • Perform the duties of Welder (separate job descriptions) as demand requires.

Job Specific Requirement/Knowledge/Experience:

  • A minimum of 5 years of equivalent work experience in a large/heavy custom steel fabrication environment.
  • Preference to a graduate of a credited Welder Fitter program and/or completion of college or vocational/technical training. Valid and current CWB Welding Tickets are mandatory.
  • Previous experience working within an ISO9001 environment is preferred. Must be familiar with all position welding and a variety of welding processes (i.e. GMAW, FCAW, SAW)
  • Must be able to work to close tolerances.
  • Should be able to lift between 50-75lbs
  • Trade Tools: welding helmet, chipping hammer, side cutters, wire brush, vice grip, 25’ & 50’ tape measure, hammer, center punch, chalk line, hand magnets, squares, trammel points, scribe.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Overtime

  • welding: 3 years (required)

  • CWB Certified (preferred)

  • Night Shift (required)

title: Machine Operator/ Assembler/Packer
description:
Kemflo Canada seeks highly motivated and skilled individuals to contribute to our continued growth and success. Commonly sought professions include machine operators, set-up technicians, material handler, tool design engineer and many more. If you are interested in applying, answer the screening questions and upload your resume. You can also call us at 905-832-1217. Kemflo Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodations. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for Kemflo Canada. To request an accommodation, please contact our Human Resource Manager.


Kemflo Canada is an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability or national origin. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.


Machine Operator/Assembler/Packer


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Starting at $16.00 per hour

Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

Open to Canadian Citizens

All employees are expected to be vaccinated as a condition of employment.


Responsibilities:

  • Follow production instructions of supervisor to ensure quality
  • Maintained quality and quantity during the shift
  • Clean and maintain good housekeeping practices
  • Ensure that Machines are producing quality products by checking on output
  • Pack and Label product as per quality standards
  • Provide relevant information regarding progress to supervisors
  • Clean and maintained equipment and work area

 

Work Safe:

  •  Steel toed shoes is always a must in the plant. Candidate must provide own safety shoes.
  • Safety glasses are the responsibility of the employee.
  • Must adhere to established policies and procedure.
  • Must always wear PPE.

 

Physical Requirements

  • Stand and walk for 8 hours
  • Ability to lift and move loads over 50lbs

title: BT80 - Food Machine Operator
description:
Are you in the market for a career opportunity that combines your expertise in food technology with your passion for food security and equality?

Look no further! Trendi is hiring a BioTrim80 (BT80) Operator and wants YOU to join our family!

Who Are You?
  • Enthusiastic about technology and learning new skills? You’re a think-outside-the-box kind of person!
  • An innovative contributor who understands the importance of meticulous documentation?
  • Exceptional organization and reporting skills? You thrive working solo or unsupervised, when required!
  • Outstanding communication abilities that foster meaningful connections will clients and colleagues?
  • Enthusiastic about technology and learning new skills? You’re a think-outside-the-box kind of person!

A Day in the Life
  • You know when to do things by-the-book and when to think outside the box! Keep the BioTrim running smoothly by operating according to the established processing protocols.
  • Support our mission of sustainability by ensuring the BioTrim equipment is maintained in good working condition – this means that equipment is clean and any part requiring repair is promptly attended to!
  • Maintain a detailed logbook of all repairs and ensure inventory of equipment and spare parts is well-documented.
  • Use your expertise and people skills to coordinate the purchase and installation of any new equipment in the BioTrim.
  • Leverage your collaborative spirit and mechanical expertise to assist the Food Safety Specialist in developing and implementing the Food Safety Program and updating the cleaning and sanitation program when required. (Make sure all cleaning chemicals, sanitizers and lubricants are CFIA approved!)
  • You directly contribute to our mission by owning the BioTrim process from start to finish! Arrange reception of raw materials to be processed in the BioTrim and the shipping of the freeze-dried products.

What You Bring To The Table
  • Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Food Engineering and Processing, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in the food industry embracing your passion for food and technology.
  • You’re a pro at adapting to new environments, working away from home, and enjoy leading a NOMADIC lifestyle.
  • You bring a strong understanding of HACCP plans and have the knowledge and confidence to implement plans!
  • Mechanical aptitude will strongly support your success as a BT80 Operator.
  • You are able to lift 50+ lbs.

Why Trendi?

Here, at Trendi, we value and actively work to ensure all employees are equipped with tools necessary to become the best, healthiest, and most passionate version of themselves. Here’s a bit about how you can expect us to support you:
  • Competitive Compensation & Generous Benefits – Your passion, drive, and contributions are the reason Trendi is successful. We offer a competitive base salary (starting at $24/hour), a generous bonus program (that’s actually attainable), and comprehensive benefits to care for you and your family.
  • Vacations, Time Off & Remote Work – You’re human, which means you need to pursue your passions, enjoy time with people you love, and prioritize work-life balance.
  • Personal & Professional Development – When you learn, grow, and achieve your goals we all win. From articles and webinars to mentorship, events, and continued education, we’ve never found a growth opportunity we didn’t love! We’re small, and we recognize that means your growth may outpace ours. In fact, we consider that a win! We love and celebrate our alum!  

About Trendi

We’ve all thrown out a bag of rotten fruit before. None of us are perfect. Especially on the Trendi team, where we each have a unique story, a quirky personality, and many flaws. Our focus is undoubtedly on eliminating the food waste crisis, particularly in Canada where we waste 58% of the food we produce. With that said, we’re not tree-hugging sustainability gurus; we’re just regular people like you.

But regular people can make a big difference. You can help us work towards rescuing the 1.3 billion tonnes of unused food before it’s wasted every year, upcycle it, and make it accessible to 800 million people that go hungry daily.

We do it all with robotics, AI, automation, delicious food, and most importantly our quirky team of misfits. Our team doesn’t work here because they just need a job. They do it because this mission propels them and gives them an opportunity to personally grow and become a kick-a$$ change maker.

If this is something you can get behind, we want to hear from you. Just like the misfit food we rescue, tell us how you’re a misfit.

Trendi is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We know from experience that a diverse team that reflects our planet, partners and community stakeholders is central to ensuring varied perspectives and better ideas to solve the complex problem of food waste. Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion are unwavering and the core of how we build our team, cultivate leaders and create our impact. We do not discriminate, and we are open to anyone, whoever you are, wherever you’re from, however you identify and whatever your story. If you’re qualified for the job and can get on board with our mission and community, we’re ready to talk.

Does this sound like the opportunity you have been waiting for?

Apply today with your resume!

Porcupine Canvas Manufacturing, specializing in the production of various industrially sewn products – industrial bags, tipis, and various sorts of canvas tents - is presently in search of a CNC operator / industrial pattern / cutter operator. The position is from 3:30 pm to 11:30 pm - Monday to Friday.

The company is located in Boucherville, Quebec – and the position is a full time permanent one.

PRINCIPAL TASKS:

  • Ability to read and interpret drawings for a CNC machine
  • Must be able to physically stand at the machine for most of the working hours and walk around the machine as required
  • Computer knowledge and ability to learn programs quickly
  • Leader mentality - must be able to delegate tasks and direction to other team members
  • Be able to write up the appropriate process procedures for patterns and prototypes

title: Outilleur(euse)
description:
Le poste d'outilleur / opérateur CNC est principalement responsable de l'exploitation de diverses machines-outils de coupe, allant d'un fonctionnement entièrement manuel à des centres d'usinage entièrement automatisés à commande numérique par ordinateur (CNC). Le poste exige également la planification, la fabrication et la fabrication de matrices, de modèles et de jauges d'une complexité extrême et des compétences en saisie de données informatiques. La connaissance de la séparation des matrices de moulage de précision, de la programmation des machines CNC et du programme NX est un atout.

1. Analyse les besoins d'usinage et détermine les meilleures options économiques.
2. Effectue toutes les configurations de l'équipement et des moules en utilisant la connaissance des pratiques et des procédures de l'atelier d'usinage.
3. Installe les outils de coupe appropriés dans la machine-outil, selon l'opération d'usinage.
4. Effectue des usinages complexes à l'aide de tours horizontaux, de fraiseuses verticales et de rectifieuses planes.
5. Lit les diagrammes de tolérance et utilise des jauges pour assurer des tolérances appropriées.
6. Lit les dessins 2D/esquisses 3D instructions conceptuelles.
7. Prépare le matériel pour l'usinage CNC avec la coopération de l'opérateur de la machine CNC.
8. Utilise périodiquement des machines CNC.
9. Effectue des usinages complexes à l'aide de tours horizontaux, de fraiseuses verticales et de rectifieuses planes.
10. Planifie la réparation ou les modifications de moules complexes et répare ou modifie au besoin.
11. Répare les matrices, les jauges et les accessoires endommagés selon les instructions.
12. Fabriquer des montages et des outils à partir d'ébauches et de dessins techniques.
13. Effectue des opérations d'usinage/réparation précises sur des pièces moulées qui ne peuvent être usinées par d'autres départements.
14. Utiliser une variété d'instruments et d'équipements d'inspection de précision.
15. Inspecte les matrices/inserts pour s'assurer qu'ils sont conformes aux spécifications établies.
16. Configure et affûte les forêts et les coupe-contours.
17. Suit les demandes d'ordre de travail d'outil selon les instructions d'ingénierie.
18. Demande et examine les devis pour les fournitures, y compris le matériel, les outils de coupe, l'équipement de sécurité et d'autres matériaux pour les départements d'usinage de la salle d'outils, du FTP et de la porte CNC.
19. Prépare la demande de matériel dans Oracle et assure le suivi des commandes.
20. Ouvre et ferme les commandes complètes dans le programme MP2. Imprime les commandes codées pour les autres opérateurs dans la salle d'outils.
21. Maintient la zone de travail dans un état propre et sécuritaire.

Éducation : Diplôme d'études secondaires ou combinaison équivalente d'expérience et de formation.

Expérience : Quatre ans d'expérience avec des tours horizontaux, des fraiseuses verticales et d'autres machines de découpe de métaux. Connaissances en informatique requises. Plus de cinq années d'expérience requises pour une maîtrise satisfaisante de l'emploi.

Compétences professionnelles :
- Doit être capable de penser logiquement pour analyser les situations
- Doit être capable de travailler rapidement et avec précision pour respecter les horaires
- Doit avoir une excellente connaissance pratique des machines, y compris la CNC, comment configurer et faire fonctionner des équipements complexes, et une compréhension de la trigonométrie, de la géométrie et des mathématiques générales
- Doit être capable de lire, d'écrire et de comprendre des instructions écrites et verbales
- Doit être capable de lire et de travailler sur des plans d'usinage et de détail
- Doit comprendre les techniques de brasage et de soudure à l'argent pour la réparation d'outils
- Capacité à utiliser des mathématiques avancées, à lire et à interpréter des dessins et des spécifications extrêmement complexes
- Doit avoir des aptitudes mécaniques, être motivé avec une attitude positive
- Doit avoir une capacité de levage sans restriction
- Doit être un joueur d'équipe, collaborer avec les autres, offrir de l'aide et de l'assistance
- Doit avoir la capacité de travailler dans des environnements individuels et d'équipe
- Doit être capable de travailler avec un minimum de supervision
- Doit être ouvert pour effectuer d'autres tâches assignées
Compétences en communication verbale et écrite en anglais et/ou en français

title: Hycorr Rotary Die Cutter
description:
Job Description:

1. Work in a safe manner at all times by following all company safety procedures and rules.
2. Wear complete Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) before, during and while inside the production area. Ensure that all Hycorr crews are wearing complete PPE’s, advise to wear accordingly before operating the machine.
3. Keep a safe distance away from the tow motor when corrugated sheets are being brought to the machine.
4. Review work orders to determine job specifications and initial the “Special Instructions” on the Factory Ticket to indicate review and understanding.
5. Review bundle counts and stacking patterns.
6. Ensure Hycorr 2 nd person reviews, understands and initials the “Special Instructions” on the Factory Tickets.
7. Direct and assign activities (including the assisting of set up) of Hycorr crew members -2 nd person, 3rd person and 4 th (if personnel required) and ensure that safety procedures are adhered to.
8. Inputs order information into the Amtech computer in the plant data collection section.
9. Retrieve SRD die from die rack. Lift the die off the rack or floor. Request assistance from Hycorr 2 nd person if needed.
10. Conduct or assist in machine set up by properly positioning machine settings for ink, delivery and feeder units. Mount print plates on cylinder(s) to optimize print quality, registration and anilox rolls. Mount cutting dies, put ink in the machine and remove dies for cleaning.
11. Monitor ink levels, viscosity and pH level.
12. Setup the take off section back end as well as the front- end feed section of the machine and perform feeding duties when required.
13. Set-up and inspect print and die cut sections in accordance with proper setup
techniques/standards.
14. Cut plastic straps on corrugated sheets using proper tools/equipment, stand back and hold strap in position when cutting it to avoid being hit by the strap under pressure.
